name: Holiday Inn Express Forsyth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like so many other Holiday Inn Express locations, it was difficult finding where to turn to get to the property. It was easy to miss the first turn which is right next to the Interstate ramp. Once you get that right, you have to trust the hotel is there because it is hidden behind a Ramada conference center. The interior layout is a little confusing at first, too, because of side entrances that come into the same hallway. Overall, though, this hotel is clean, well-managed and comfortable for a night off the Interstate.
reviews.title: Pleasant place to stay (once you find it)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This location has easy access from the highway. It is clean and comfortable and the staff is very friendly. Looks like this hotel has been recently remodeled, because the first thing I noticed were the spotless carpets. After walking thru the halls & upon arriving in our room, I noticed everything was fresh and clean. The Heat/AC unit was newer and we had a flat screen HD TV in our room. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay. Next trip to Florida, I'm staying the night here!
reviews.title: Easy Access...

reviews.text: The only thing I didn't like was that all the doors slam hard.( there's got to be someway to correct that problem).
reviews.title: Stuck on the smoking floor...

reviews.text: We arrived here on 2-11-13 en route to Florida. We were stuck on the third floor, which is largely a smoking floor. Our bedcovers smelled like someone had dumped a pint of wintergreen oil on them (up by head). It was so powerful I could not sleep. I'm not one to complain, I usually suffer through it and go on my way, but I could not endure this. I went down to the lobby and requested new sheets/blankets or another room. They transferred us to another room. That room smelled like smoke badly, especially the bathroom. My wife and I endured it, but it was very unpleasant. The hallway smelled like smoke big time. What a nasty habit - no wonder businesses are limiting or banning smoking altogether.
reviews.title: comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These factors combined to make our stay there very distasteful. The breakfast is good, but the overall cleanliness of the third floor was abominable.
reviews.title: Quick stay, nice hotel

reviews.text: We are a family of four and enjoyed our stay. The price was great. We stayed overnight and enjoyed a good clean room with an excellent breakfast. The worker in the breakfast area kept the bar stocked and the dining room clean. We'll definitely stay there again if we need a place outside of Macon.
reviews.title: Great Overnight Stay!

reviews.text: This older Holiday Inn Express isn't quite as nice looking on the outside as the more modern HI Express hotels, but they were gracious and helpful. Breakfast choices were similar to what most hotels under $100/night offer. Location is close to I-75 and a litttle hard to find at first, but there are two or three ways to get to the parking lot, so that's hardlt and issue. I would return based on my one experience.
reviews.title: Good Nights Stay

reviews.text: Definitely your best option in Forsyth, whether you are just passing through or there for LEO training. Average breakfast, but the rooms are nice and the hotel is well-maintained. Be sure to sign up for the Priority Rewards program to get credit at Holiday Inns and other prestigious properties such as Intercontinental when you travel.
reviews.title: Your best option in Forsyth, by far...

reviews.text: Easy off & on from interstate - Very clean & roomy - Nice sitting area in lobby with fireplace - Hot breakfast buffet that was well-attended by staff - Gentleman at the desk was more than accommodating - Some rooms do not have mini fridge & microwave, so if these are things you would like in your room, be sure to make the request when making reservations - Definitely recommend this location.
reviews.title: VERY NICE PLACE TO STAY

reviews.text: Stayed here on our way to Florida because they are pet friendly with only a $15 fee . Also the bed was very comfortable. That's all I can say that was positive, the rooms are very small but for a quick overnight it was ok
reviews.title: Pet friendly

reviews.text: I stop at this hotel when I am traveling and need to stop for the night. I can county on the staff being very friendly when I check in at 10 or 11 at night. I have stopped here enough times that I ask for the single room since I am by myself. I usually grab a cinnamon roll and coffee before hitting the road the next morning and they are always fresh. I know I can count on this hotel.
reviews.title: Great night's sleep

reviews.text: I had to stay in Forsyth GA for business. Out of the few basic choices I feel that the Holiday Inn Express is a fair one. Work booked the stay for me. Check in was easy and smooth. They have a guest breakfast each morning which compared to others I have had it was fairly good. The nice lady taking care of the guests in the morning is very hard working. A tip: It is one of the few hotels still offering smoking rooms. If you don’t smoke avoid the fourth floor. I am a smoker so it was nice for me but the hallway smell makes you feel like you are in an ashtray. No big deal to the smokers who enjoy the convenience of not running outside all night. If you’re not a smoker…floor 1 and 2 will do you. The hotel is right off of I-75 so it’s convenient for a quick stop overnight. The Georgia Police Training Center is close so many of the guests are police and sheriff deputies attending training. They were all very nice and quiet. It’s a safe place to stop. Don’t expect the four-star feel of traditional Holiday Inn’s in trendy spots. This is not a trendy town but the hotel will serve its purpose. You have an Ingles and CVS right across the street and are two minutes from the local fast food row. (Advice-if you have time do yourself a favor and eat at The Grits Café-you can find the reviews for that on Trip Advisor as well.) Hope this helps.
reviews.title: It get's the job done/safe

reviews.text: We had a bad experience at another area hotel and called here to reserve our room. Not sure why we looked for another place anyway when all we needed was right here. The staff, the room, breakfast, everything lives up the standards that we expect from a HIE. Keep up the good work. Wayne and ayjay were very professional and courteous, eventaking time to communicate with our 4 year old son. HIlghly recommend this hotel if you are in the Forsyth area.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed as a family after driving all day from Naples, FL on our way home to Michigan. Nice little stop. The only thing my little ones where upset that they have an outdoor pool, and it wasn't open yet. Good breakfast in the morning and typical Holiday Inn Express service. Fills up early due to its location, so make reservations while out on the road.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stop off of I-75
Friendly staff
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Holiday Inn Express a couple of days while he was attending required recertification classes. The staff greeted us with friendly faces. We awoke he first morning to annoying cigarette smoke because the idiot staying beside us decided to smoke in their NON smoking room (adjoing doors... Smoke was coming under the doors). I immediately call the front desk while very irritated. The lady that answered was extremely nice. She told me to talk with the manager when he arrived. She must have sent word to the occupants because the smoke faded a little. When the manager, Tom, arrived he was extremely nice and accommodating. He had an air purifier placed in our room and by the time I arrived back from a nice complimentary breakfast our roomed smelled extremely fresh and smoke free!

We stopped here New Year's Eve on our way to Florida. It's very easy access off of I75. The room was clean and quiet. Out only problem was finding something to eat late evening on the holiday evening. Taco Bell was open and that was just fine since we were tired and just wanted to go to bed. The staff were very kind and courteous. The complitmentary breakfast was good as it always is at Holiday Inn Express. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Perfect Stopover

reviews.text: We stayed here New Year's Eve on our way to Florida. Easy access off I75. The only problem we had was trying to get a quick bite to eat. Taco Bell & Pizza Hut were open on this Holiday Eve and that was fine. Our room was clean and quiet. The breakfast was good as it aways is. Found the staff to be very nice and friendly. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Perfect stopover!

reviews.text: Staff was very friendly
reviews.title: Very nice pet friendly hotel

reviews.text: Place was very clean
reviews.title: Great night sleep

reviews.text: Breakfast was fresh and hot
reviews.title: Average Hotel, Clean, Nice Staff, NO MICROWAVE or REFRIGERATOR

description: Discover the Holiday Inn Express in Forsyth, Georgia. You ll find comfort and modern luxury at one of the most convenience location in Central Georgia. Southern hospitality with modern amenities, the Holiday Inn Express in Forsyth is the ideal destination. Located at I-75 at Exit 186 you can reach both Atlanta and Macon with ease. Whether you re coming to Forsyth for business or just for fun your room at The Holiday Inn Express is your personal retreat. You ll have room to work, relax and make the most of your day. Amenities such as high-speed internet, work center, plush towels and luxurious bedding mean every night is a great night and every day starts right. You can take a dip in our pool; relax with a cool one at CT s Bar & Grill. When it is time to dine you can enjoy a dining adventure at Leland s Restaurant. Then best of Central Georgia is waiting for you at Holiday Inn Express in Forsyth, Georgia.
